# MDLLight

**Class**

The abstract superclass for objects that describe light sources in a scene.

## Declaration

```swift
class MDLLight
```

## Overview

When you load lights from an asset file using the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAsset] class or create lights when building an asset for export, you use one or more of the concrete subclasses [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLPhysicallyPlausibleLight], [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLAreaLight], [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLPhotometricLight], or [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLightProbe].

## Working with Lights

- **irradiance(atPoint:)**: Returns the radiance of the light as received at a specific point in the same scene.
- **irradiance(atPoint:colorSpace:)**: Returns the radiance of the light as received at a specific point in the same scene, expressed using the specified color space.
- **lightType**: The type of the light.
- **colorSpace**: The name of the Core Graphics color space to be used for interpreting the light’s color information.

## Constants

- **MDLLightType**: Options for the shape and style of illumination provided by a light, used by the [doc://com.apple.modelio/documentation/ModelIO/MDLLight/lightType] property.

## Lights

- **MDLAreaLight**: A light source that illuminates a 3D scene from an area with a specific shape.
- **MDLLightProbe**: A light source described in terms of the variations in color and intensity of its illumination in all directions.
- **MDLLightProbeIrradianceDataSource**: Adopt this protocol to provide information for use in automatic placement of light probes around a scene.
- **MDLPhotometricLight**: A light source whose shape, direction, and intensity of illumination are determined by a photometric profile.
- **MDLPhysicallyPlausibleLight**: A light source for use in shading models based on real-world physics.

## Inherits From

- MDLPhysicallyPlausibleLight
